title: Breakfast in Blanton
description:
Start your day right with Breakfast in Blanton. A cozy morning event with free food, good vibes, and a chance to connect with your fellow residents! 
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Walk with the President during International Education Week!
Free Swim Lessons - Intermediate
description:
Take your swimming to the next level! Get introduced to new strokes or work on the ones you already know. These lessons are for swimmers who are a little more comfortable in the water but still want to improve their technique and expand what skills they know.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Swimming unassisted on your front and back  
 Improve treading (in the deep end) 
 Improving breath control in the water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Dolphin Kick) 
 Introduction to and/or improving your breaststroke 
 Swimming laps 
 Introduction to open and flip turns 
 Introduction to Butterfly 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20 
 Wednesday:11-12 PM and 5-6PM 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

title: Blind Date With a Book Sale
[H&H Week 2025] COV 101: Covenant House Presentation
description:
Since 1989, Covenant House New Jersey has provided housing and supportive services for youth experiencing homelessness. What began as a commitment to shelter and support has grown into a powerful movement—one that offers safety, healing, and opportunity to young people facing homelessness and survivors of human trafficking. 
 Learn more about how their work transforms lives! 
   
 *This event counts for service hours.*

title: Higher Education (MA) Virtual Information Session
description:
Build your career in Higher Education    
 Whether you're already working in  higher ed  or looking to break into the field, our flexible program is designed to meet you where you are - and help you go even further. 
 We're hosting a  virtual information session on November 19  at 12:00 PM . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. 
 Our coursework offers a broad focus on administration and leadership, preparing students for a variety of roles in higher education. The curriculum integrates organizational and social science perspectives and explores key administrative and programmatic issues.

title: Feminist Scholars and Global Advocacy at the United Nations
organization: Bloomfield Office of International Student Services
location: Shelby Art Room at Bloomfield College Library
description: Join us for an inspiring panel discussion featuring feminist scholars engaged in global advocacy at the United Nations!  Through their stories and experiences, explore how knowledge, passion, and collaboration advance gender equality across borders. All are welcome!

title: Office of Global Engagement Presents: Thanksgiving Lunch
description:
Join the Office of Global Engagement for a traditional American Thanksgiving meal on Wednesday, November 19 at 12:00pm. We will play games, eat well, and share what we are thankful for with new friends! This event is for current students ONLY, please do not bring any guests. 
 Must RSVP, space is limited!

title: Free Swim Lessons *Beginner*
description:
Never swam before? No problem! These lessons will give you the important foundational skills in swimming and help you be more comfortable in the pool. Learn how to use proper breath control, float, and swim with a kickboard.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Being comfortable in the water 
 Learning how to float on your back and front 
 Learning how to kick off the wall with a kickboard 
 Introducing proper breath control in the water 
 Learning how to tread water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Froggy Kick) 
 Being comfortable in the deep end  
 Introducing arms to your strokes 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20 
 Wednesday: 2-3PM and 5-6PM 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

location: University Hall 1020 - Bard-Blount Family Lecture Hall

title: De-Stress and Gratitude Craft Session
description:
Take a break before Thanksgiving and join CAPS & the Segal Gallery Staff for a cozy, creative afternoon focused on gratitude through crafting. 
 Enjoy hands-on crafts, relaxing music, and a chance to pause and reflect on what you’re thankful for this season. Stop by anytime between 1:30 & 3:30. All materials provided — just bring yourself and a friend.

title: General Miembro Meeting
description: Join the Latin American Student Organization for our weekly General Miembro Meeting where we have fun activities planned to learn about different Latin cultures! Check out our instagram @laso1970 for this week's topic!

title: MSU Republicans General Meeting
description: Are you looking to make a difference in the world? Join us for an engaging meeting on how to get involved in local politics. We'll explore current issues, brainstorm creative ways to engage students, and discuss how you can make a real impact on upcoming campaigns and events.

title: Music Club GBM
description: General body meeting for the MSMC

title: Haitian Student Association General Body Meeting
description: Sak Pasè! Welcome to HSA’s General Body meetings, where we go beyond the culture and tackle college life, personal life and serious topics in the world of a college student today. Although we are a culturally Haitian-based Organization, all are loved and all are welcomed! find us in the Red Hawk Nest, on the lower floor of the Student Center every Wednesday, 2:00-3:30!

title: Global Fashion Show
location: Student Center Ballrooms A and B
description:
Get ready for an unforgettable journey around the world, told through the language of fashion! The International Student Association in collaboration with the Office of Global Engagement is thrilled to present  Global Fashion Show  dedicated to celebrating the breathtaking diversity of traditional clothing from all over the world. All are welcome to attend the event. Student Center Ballrooms A and B.  
 Got traditional wear? 👗 We've got a runway! ✨ Sign up to model at the vibrant Global Fashion Show! Link https://forms.gle/CVNgSPru1PQAB6nVA No prior modeling experience is required—just pride in your culture, and a willingness to share. Prizes/Gift cards will be given to participants!

title: Evaluating Sources
description:
Join our workshop to learn the art of evaluating sources. Learn to discern credible sources, spot bias, and assess relevance. Gain critical thinking skills vital for academic success and informed decision-making.

title: On View: The Age of Black Metal by Afrotectopia
Student Panel Discussion on Human Rights in a Global Era
organization: Bloomfield Office of International Student Services
description: Engage with student voices in a powerful discussion on global human rights, moderated by Dr. Harry Franqui-Rivera, Associate Professor of History and Geography at BCMSU. Hear diverse perspectives on key issues, challenges, and the role of young leaders in fostering change worldwide. Join us to explore pathways toward a more just and equitable world. A reception will follow, offering an opportunity to engage with panelists and fellow attendees.

title: Tabling
description: Showcase what our organization is about, invite people to join us, and have friendly conversations about Faith!

title: Coquito Conmigo
description: Warm up the season with our homemade Coquito! This creamy Puerto Rican holiday drink is made with love and a twist—choose from our classic Original or tropical flavors like Guava, Mango, and Passion Fruit. Every purchase supports Lambda Theta Phi’s community efforts, so come grab a cup of tradition with a modern flavor spin.

location: Student Center Quad Information Table 1 - Information Table 1

title: Spanish Writing Center -Workshop Series - Online - November
organization: Center for Latino Heritage & Spanish Language Excellence
description:
This workshop offers a comprehensive exploration of direct, indirect, and reflexive pronouns, emphasizing their nuanced uses in complex sentence structures. We will examine pronoun placement, the interaction of multiple pronouns within the same clause, and variations in usage across formal and informal registers. 
   
 Zoom Classroom: 
 Join URL:  https://montclair.zoom.us/j/91959315458

title: Information Session: Grad Student Journal Article Writing Group
description:
Are you a graduate student working on a journal article for publication? Learn more about the Grad Student Journal Article Writing Group! This writing group will run over 13 weeks during the Spring semester (January 26 - April 24, 2026), with a week off in March. Weekly topics will include: publication venues, selecting a journal, writing your argument, literature review, citation management and more. We will use Wendy Laura Belcher’s  Writing  Your Journal Article in Twelve Weeks  to guide the discussions and work. Register to attend this Zoom information session where we will discuss how the program will run, the expected time commitment, and answer any other questions you may have. Please contact our Graduate Assistant, Emily Cepin, at  cepine1@montclair.edu  with any questions. A limited number of seats are available. If you would like to register for the club without attending an info session, you may do so by completing this  registration form . Sponsored by the Center for Writing Excellence and the University Libraries. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14826424
